indications: Indications hypertensive crisis (but no longer recommended—see section 2.5)
name: GUANETHIDINE MONOSULPHATE
cautions: Cautions  coronary or cerebral arteriosclerosis, asthma, history of peptic ulceration;  interactions: Appendix 1 (adrenergic neurone blockers)
side-effects:
Side-effects postural hypotension, failure of ejaculation,
fluid retention, nasal congestion, headache, diarrhoea, drowsiness
doses:
By intramuscular injection, 10–20 mg, repeated
after 3 hours if required
pregnancy:
Pregnancy postural hypotension and reduced uteroplacental perfusion;
should not be used to treat hypertension in pregnancy
